Detailed Description

The Exception manager contains an error dialog that can be used when a error occure or when we use qWarning, qCritical, qError, qDebug. When an fatal error occure, the signal errorTriggered is emited.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ExceptionManager::~ExceptionManager (  )  [virtual]

Member Function Documentation

QErrorMessage * ExceptionManager::errorDialog (  )  const

The dialog created and used to show message. This dialog is automatically called when Qt macro (qDebug, ...) is used.

void ExceptionManager::errorTriggered (  )  [signal]

Signal emited when notifyError is called and the exception manager is set to be fatal.

void ExceptionManager::installExceptionHandler (  )  [static]

Install the Exception Handler but doesn't create the exception manager if not needed.

QStringList ExceptionManager::stackTrace (  )  const

Stack trace generated by the Operating System. The application must be compiled with -rdynamic in Gnu/Linux. This stack is unused on Windows.
